pullRequest.body:
added lemma to prove a subgraph is a matching iff the subgraph mapped by an isomorphism is a matching.
Added in order to support a proof of Tutte's theorem, and generalize results to be introduced in #15666

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

Thanks! ðŸš€

maintainer merge
I have strain injuries to both wrists, hence must not type much. Please apologise the poor spelling, vague indications and general conciseness.

Thanks! ðŸš€

maintainer merge

Can you first show that matchings can be pushforwarded along bijective graph homs?
```suggestion
lemma Iso.isMatching_map {G' : SimpleGraph W} {M : Subgraph G} (f : SimpleGraph.Iso G G') :
    (M.map f.toHom).IsMatching â†” M.IsMatching := by
```
By this you mean the edit you suggested, right? In that case it was the case that the name mismatched the contents, and I've fixed that:)

No, a graph isomorphism is stronger than a bijective graph homomorphism. I rather mean something like
```
protected lemma IsMatching.map {G' : SimpleGraph W} {M : Subgraph G} (f : G â†’g G') (hf : Bijective f) :
    M.IsMatching â†’ (M.map f.toHom).IsMatching := by
```
Then you can prove `Iso.isMatching_map` by two applications of `IsMatching.map`
It took a while, but I finally got to it:)
misnamed
Fixed:)

```suggestion
  rintro _ âŸ¨v, hv, rflâŸ©
```

```suggestion
lemma Iso.isMatching_map {G' : SimpleGraph W} {M : Subgraph G} (f : G â‰ƒg G') :
```

```suggestion
  exact âŸ¨fun h â†¦ by simpa using h.map f.symm.toHom f.symm.bijective, .map f.toHom f.bijectiveâŸ©
```
unntested

```suggestion
  refine âŸ¨by simp only [Relation.map_apply]; exact âŸ¨v, v', hv'.1, rfl, rflâŸ©, ?_âŸ©
```

```suggestion
    (M.map f.toHom).IsMatching â†” M.IsMatching where
   mp h := by simpa [â† map_comp] using h.map f.symm.toHom f.symm.bijective
   mpr := .map f.toHom f.bijective
```

```suggestion
protected lemma IsMatching.map {G' : SimpleGraph W} {M : Subgraph G} (f : G â†’g G')
    (hf : Injective f) (hM : M.IsMatching) : (M.map f).IsMatching := by
  rintro _ âŸ¨v, hv, rflâŸ©
  obtain âŸ¨v', hv'âŸ© := hM hv
  use f v'
  refine âŸ¨âŸ¨v, v', hv'.1, rfl, rflâŸ©, ?_âŸ©
  rintro _ âŸ¨w, w', hw, hw', rflâŸ©
  cases hf hw'.symm
  rw [hv'.2 w' hw]

@[simp]
lemma Iso.isMatching_map {G' : SimpleGraph W} {M : Subgraph G} (f : G â‰ƒg G') :
    (M.map f.toHom).IsMatching â†” M.IsMatching where
   mp h := by simpa [â† map_comp] using h.map f.symm.toHom f.symm.injective
   mpr := .map f.toHom f.injective
   
```

The first lemma is true assuming only that `f` is injective rather than bijective

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Matching): graph isomorphisms preserve matchings
